intro: Pagamea anisophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leafed pagamea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, typically displaying white or pale yellow petals. Pagamea anisophylla is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
